contexts.context: ...in the newspapers by friendly appreciations. Admiration was <mark>almost</mark> always mingled with a sort of sadness–almost...
...almost always mingled with a sort of sadness–<mark>almost</mark> as though obituary notices were written rather than congratulations...
.... He shows us that Bach to-day is <mark>almost</mark> universally misunderstood by pianists. They romanticise him,...
